actions.title: Delete unnecessary files
actions.description: Use the `rm` command to remove files. For example, `rm file.txt` will delete `file.txt` from the current directory.

actions.title: Organize files into folders
actions.description: Use the `mv` command to move files to specific folders. For example, `mv file.txt folder/` will move `file.txt` to the `folder/` directory.

actions.title: Share pictures with friends
actions.description: Use a file-sharing service like Dropbox, Google Drive, or WeTransfer to share files with friends. Alternatively, use the `scp` command to securely copy files to a remote server. For example, `scp file.txt user@server:/path/to/destination` will copy `file.txt` to the `/path/to/destination` directory on the remote server.

actions.title: Set wallpapers
actions.description: Use the `feh` command to set a wallpaper. For example, `feh --bg-scale wallpaper.jpg` will set `wallpaper.jpg` as the wallpaper.

actions.title: Edit pictures
actions.description: Use an image editing tool like GIMP or ImageMagick to edit pictures. For example, `gimp image.jpg` will open `image.jpg` in GIMP for editing.
